author: stsp
msg: Follow-up to r1590445:
* tools/dev/unix-build/Makefile.svn: In my custom build script which is also
used by the bb-openbsd buildbot, really fix the build with libReSSL.
Apply SSL-related patches during unpack stage instead of configure stage.
Disable use of RAND_egd() which libReSSL doesn't support.

author: mattsicker
msg: Improve locking usage.
- Call System.currentTimeMillis() outside of a synchronized context.
- Use AtomicInteger over volatile (though it would be nice if it
included a bit mask checking operation).
- Use a Lock over synchronized(this).

author: stefan2
msg: [Reverted in r1598291]
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(svn_io__next_chunk_size): Fix typo in a comment. No functional change.

author: stefan2
msg: Fix and slightly simplify the debugging support in our membuffer cache.
It had been broken a while ago by the removal of the private sub-pool
from the cache frontends.
We use the same fixed-size buffer holding the type identifier extracted
from the cache prefix string everywhere we want a dev-visible type string.
To make that work, we double to buffer size, make the buffer always
available, be more intelligent when extracting the type part from the
original prefix and drop the old prefix duplicate.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/cache-membuffer.c
(PREFIX_TAIL_LEN): Make always available and double size to accomodate
texts like "l2p-header".
(get_prefix_tail): Make always available and trim the tail to just the
type ID in case we find the separating ':'.
(DEBUG_CACHE_MEMBUFFER_INIT_TAG): Add pool parameter as the cache has no
local pool instance anymore.  Also,
access to common prefix buffer now.
(entry_tag_t): Have a common, fixed-length prefix tail (=type) buffer.
(svn_membuffer_cache_t,
svn_membuffer_cache_get,
svn_membuffer_cache_set,
svn_membuffer_cache_get_partial,
svn_membuffer_cache_set_partial): Provide the debug macro with a pool.
(svn_membuffer_cache_get_info): Get the ID from the common buffer now.
(svn_cache__create_membuffer_cache): Update initialization code.

author: rmarroquin
msg: Adding news about the 0.4 release.
